audit_summary: Woodfire Westport has strong public reputation signals with 573 Google reviews and a near-perfect desktop performance score, but the website currently offers no contact form or booking system — leaving visitors with no direct way to engage. This is the most significant conversion gap across all signals and should be treated as an immediate priority. Adding even a basic enquiry pathway would directly leverage the reputational traffic the business is already generating.

performance: Mobile PageSpeed score of 74 indicates moderate performance and sits one point below the strong threshold — possible contributing factors include unoptimised images or render-blocking scripts, though this cannot be confirmed from public signals alone
Desktop PageSpeed score of 99 is strong — the core build is technically well-optimised
mobile_ux: Mobile UX is rated ok — the site is functional on mobile, but the absence of any contact or booking pathway means mobile visitors have no conversion route regardless of usability
Adding a prominent click-to-call button and an enquiry or booking CTA as immediate priorities would address both the UX friction and the conversion gap simultaneously
conversion: No contact form is present — visitors currently have no way to send a direct enquiry from the website
No booking or reservation system is present — for a hospitality business with 573 reviews this is a critical conversion gap
Notes confirm no online ordering or booking system is visible and the single-page layout offers no dedicated conversion sections
seo_fundamentals: No blog or updates section is present — the site offers no dynamic content to support ongoing search visibility
Notes confirm a single-page layout with minimal content depth and no dedicated about section — limited indexable content reduces keyword reach
Notes explicitly state limited structured SEO content — local schema markup and on-page improvements would strengthen local search appearance
trust_social_proof: 4.6 Google rating across 573 reviews is an exceptionally strong trust signal and represents significant earned credibility
This social proof is not visibly surfaced on the website — embedding a Google Reviews widget would convert this reputational asset into an on-site conversion tool
security_maintenance: SSL is active — secure browsing is in place
Site runs on WordPress — keeping themes, plugins, and core updated on a regular schedule is recommended to maintain stability and performance

p1_quick_wins: Add a contact form or enquiry button immediately — this is the most urgent gap and currently leaves visitors with no way to engage with the business from the website
Add a click-to-call button visible on mobile — lowest-effort conversion addition for a restaurant audience browsing on the go
p2_growth_improvements: Add an online booking or reservation system — directly converts the strong review-driven traffic into seated customers
Embed a Google Reviews widget to surface the 573-review, 4.6-rating social proof on the site itself
Review mobile PageSpeed — targeted image compression could push the score from moderate to strong with minimal structural change
p3_strategic_enhancements: Expand from single-page to multi-page structure to support deeper SEO coverage, add an about section, and better reflect the full offering to new visitors
Introduce LocalBusiness and Restaurant schema markup to strengthen local search appearance given the notes indicate limited structured SEO content currently

assumptions_and_unknowns: Social media links and profiles were not included in the input
Schema markup presence cannot be confirmed from public signals alone
Online ordering capability was noted as absent in the notes field — confirmed as not present
next_best_action: Make contact immediately with a short pitch focused on adding a booking or enquiry system — this is an urgent conversion gap for a business with 573 reviews already driving traffic to a site that offers no way to act on it
